channel.title: O:
channel.description: Can someone point me in the direction of a good site to host a webclient on?

item.title: O:
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

[quote=“jmood128, post:16, topic:438395”][quote author=Kidpaparoach link=topic=541113.msg3965125#msg3965125 date=1333641024]
I thought the point of offshore host you could host any content… I mean like Africa china etc.
[/quote]

Just because it’s off shore doesn’t mean that country allows the content… You will have to check the terms of that area to make sure you don’t get shut down because they don’t allow copyrighted material to be hosted. Also you should know a lot of country’s have higher regulations then the USA.[/quote]
Ah right, how naive of me. Thanks

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

Kidpaparoach:

I thought the point of offshore host you could host any content… I mean like Africa china etc.

Just because it’s off shore doesn’t mean that country allows the content… You will have to check the terms of that area to make sure you don’t get shut down because they don’t allow copyrighted material to be hosted. Also you should know a lot of country’s have higher regulations then the USA.

item.title: O:
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:13, topic:438395”][quote author=jmood128 link=topic=541113.msg3964752#msg3964752 date=1333591637]
Last I checked 317 and 377 are still under copyright, so you wouldn’t be fine hosting it since they could still easily take down your site with it. The only way to beat them is if you rewrite the entire client, cache, protocol. The server is fine except for the protocol and if you’re still using an old enough server that doesn’t have a replaced Stream and Cryption class.
[/quote]
I’m pretty sure they aren’t under copyright anymore…

Even if that were the case, offshore hosting wouldn’t help at all. Jagex has many lawsuits outside of the USA and UK.[/quote]

As far as I know copyright doesn’t expire until 70 years after the copyright owners death.

ThoughtCo

How to Tell if Something Is Public Domain

When does a copyright work become public domain (how long does copyright protection for an individual work last)?

Read full topic

item.title: O:
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

jmood128:

Last I checked 317 and 377 are still under copyright, so you wouldn’t be fine hosting it since they could still easily take down your site with it. The only way to beat them is if you rewrite the entire client, cache, protocol. The server is fine except for the protocol and if you’re still using an old enough server that doesn’t have a replaced Stream and Cryption class.

I’m pretty sure they aren’t under copyright anymore…

Even if that were the case, offshore hosting wouldn’t help at all. Jagex has many lawsuits outside of the USA and UK.

Read full topic

Last I checked 317 and 377 are still under copyright, so you wouldn’t be fine hosting it since they could still easily take down your site with it. The only way to beat them is if you rewrite the entire client, cache, protocol. The server is fine except for the protocol and if you’re still using an old enough server that doesn’t have a replaced Stream and Cryption class.

item.title: O:
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:9, topic:438395”][quote author=Ix Soulcist xI link=topic=541113.msg3964285#msg3964285 date=1333567463]

You should use an offshore host to host your client itself and cache or your site can be taken down however you can use any site you wish so long as you make sure the jarred file and cache are hosted somewhere else.

He’s covered if his client is under revision 500 (presumably), give or take a few revisions. If you use a 317 or 377 client, Jagex has no business messing with you

There are a small amount of people that use that revision except the older members of RSPS itself.
[/quote]
I’ve only used up to 474, ever. I despise anything newer than that, as do many others.[/quote]
Exactly my point.

Read full topic

item.title: O:
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:9, topic:438395”][quote author=Ix Soulcist xI link=topic=541113.msg3964285#msg3964285 date=1333567463]

You should use an offshore host to host your client itself and cache or your site can be taken down however you can use any site you wish so long as you make sure the jarred file and cache are hosted somewhere else.

He’s covered if his client is under revision 500 (presumably), give or take a few revisions. If you use a 317 or 377 client, Jagex has no business messing with you

There are a small amount of people that use that revision except the older members of RSPS itself.
[/quote]
I’ve only used up to 474, ever. I despise anything newer than that, as do many others.[/quote]
No more than 30% do. Another 40% like it and about 20% like higher revisions and 10% misc with customs etc.

Read full topic
